titleStmt.title: By the Queene. The Queenes Maiestie beyng infourmed, that where the last yere in the moneth of August, by her speciall proclamation geuen at Otelande, her Maiestie directed sundry good orders to her portes, for the remouyng and expellyng of all pirates ...
Proclamations. 1570-06-06
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

titleStmt.title: By the Queene. The Queenes Maiestie beyng infourmed, that where the last yere in the moneth of August, by her speciall proclamation geuen at Otelande, her Maiestie directed sundry good orders to her portes, for the remouyng and expellyng of all pirates ...
Proclamations. 1570-06-06
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: In Povvles Churchyarde by Richarde Iugge and Iohn Cawood, Printers to the Queenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A proclamation, in support of a proclamation of 08-03-69 (STC 8016), against dealers in contraband goods.
At foot of sheet: Cum priuilegio Regi√¶ Maiestatis.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
